briefTitle: Dual-task Augmented Reality Treatment for Parkinson's Disease
officialTitle: Dual-task Augmented Reality Treatment for Parkinson's Disease (DART)

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Adult with a diagnosis of idiopathic PD
2. Self-reported gait or balance deficits
3. Hoehn and Yahr stage I-III
4. Ability to ambulate \>10 minutes continuously

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Diagnosis of dementia or any neurocognitive impairment that compromises the ability to provide informed consent
2. \>2 errors on the Short Portable Mental Status Questionnaire
3. Implanted deep brain stimulation electrodes
4. Musculoskeletal or cardiopulmonary issue that limits one's ability to engage in exercise
5. Neurological disease other than Parkinson's disease that impacts motor or cognitive function

primary.description: Walking speed (m/s) on a self-paced treadmill during single and dual task conditions
primary.timeFrame: From baseline assessment to the end of the 8-week training session

primary.description: Global score of motor function in Parkinson's disease using the Movement Disorders Society-Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale subscale III (MDS-UPDRS III). Eighteen items scored on a 0-4 scale resulting in a score ranging from 0-72. A higher score (larger number) indicates more motor symptoms.
primary.timeFrame: From baseline assessment to the end of the 8-week training session

primary.description: number of falls in the previous 30 day period
primary.timeFrame: From baseline assessment to the end of the 8-week training session
